column1: The lad went away with the can to the well
column3: and then came away home again; but the can being broken
column4: the most part of the water had run out before he got back. So his cake was very small; yet small as it was
column5: his mother asked him if he was willing to take the half of it with her blessing
column7: if he chose rather to take the whole
column8: he would only get it with her curse. The young man
column9: thinking he might have to travel a far way
column10: and not knowing when or how he might get other provisions
column11: said he would like to have the whole cake
column12: come of his mother's malison what like; so she gave him the whole cake
column13: and her malison along with it. Then he took his brother aside
column14: and gave him a knife to keep till he should come back
column15: desiring him to look at it every morning
column16: and as long as it continued to be clear
column17: then he might be sure that the owner of it was well; but if it grew dim and rusty
column18: then for certain some ill had befallen him.
